page.title: 08The Riding of the Marches
page.content: Sanquhar's annual civic festival, "The Riding of the Marches", is based on an historically relevant function. The "Marches" are the town's boundaries, and in days gone by they had to be inspected annually by the Magistrates and Councillors, accompanied by all horse owners. This was to ensure that there had been no encroachment on the town's boundaries, and that all lands and dykes were in good order. This ancient and essential inspection on horseback now forms the basis of a ceremony which takes place around 18th August each year. Exiled Sanquharians try to visit the town during the week -long celebrations. Today's activities were revived in 1910, but both World Wars intervened. Since 1947 the events have taken place annually, except 1952 when they had to be cancelled due to an outbreak of Foot and Mouth disease.
